title: Augmented Reality-Based Cultural Heritage Language Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Cultural Heritage and Digital Device Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Cultural heritage language education program for in-service professionals, offering a non-real-time online learning environment utilizing augmented reality technology.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the historical context of three or more designated cultural heritage sites using AR technology.
Learners can translate and apply specialized terminology linked to augmented reality content with over 80% accuracy.
Learners achieve 4+ points (out of 5) on simulation evaluation criteria for cultural heritage interpretation and delivery skills in digital environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
